abstract.text: A serializable description of how to sort numerics and strings.
A comparison algorithm for a specified type.
Creates a sort descriptor using a sort descriptor and a type that you specify.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to a date.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an optional date.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to a UUID.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an optional UUID.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to a Boolean value.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an optional Boolean value.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to a double.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an optional double.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to a float.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an optional float.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to a string.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an optional string.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to a string that uses a sort order that you specify.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an optional string that uses a sort order that you specify.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an optional integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an unsigned integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an optional unsigned integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an 8-bit integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an optional 8-bit integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to a 16-bit integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an optional 16-bit integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to a 32-bit integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an optional 32-bit integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to a 64-bit integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an optional 64-bit integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an unsigned 8-bit integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an optional unsigned 8-bit integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an unsigned 16-bit integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an optional unsigned 16-bit integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an unsigned 32-bit integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an optional unsigned 32-bit integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an unsigned 64-bit integer.
Creates a sort descriptor using a key path to an optional unsigned 64-bit integer.
Creates a sort descriptor by decoding from the decoder you specify.
Encodes the sort descriptor into the encoder you specify.
Provides the relative ordering of two elements.
The sort order that the sort descriptor uses to compare.
A Boolean value that indicates whether two sort descriptors are equal.
A Boolean value that indicates whether two sort descriptors are unequal.
Hashes the essential components of the comparator by feeding them into the specified hash function.
The hashed value of the comparator.
An immutable description of how to order a collection of objects according to a property common to all the objects.
Constants that indicate sort order.
A serializable description of how to sort numerics and strings.
A comparator that compares types according to their conformance to the comparable protocol.
A comparator that uses another sort comparator to provide the comparison of values at a key path.
The orderings that you can perform sorts with.
